Submodules¶

subscriptions.admin module¶

Admin configuration for the subscriptions application. Provides management of reader subscriptions to publishers and journalists.

class subscriptions.admin.SubscriptionAdmin(model, admin_site)[source]¶

Bases: ModelAdmin

Admin configuration for the Subscription model.

list_display = ('reader', 'publisher', 'journalist')¶
property media¶

subscriptions.apps module¶

Application configuration for the subscriptions application. Sets up the metadata for the component managing reader interest and access to content.

class subscriptions.apps.SubscriptionsConfig(app_name, app_module)[source]¶

Bases: AppConfig

Configuration for the subscriptions app.

name = 'subscriptions'¶

subscriptions.models module¶

Models for the subscriptions application. Defines the Subscription entity which links Readers to their favorite Publishers or Journalists.

class subscriptions.models.Subscription(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Model

Represents a reader’s subscription to a publisher or journalist. Used to determine who receives notifications when articles are published.

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

clean()[source]¶

Validate that a subscription is either to a publisher or a journalist, but not both or none.

id¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

journalist¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

reader_id¶

subscriptions.tests module¶

Tests for the subscriptions application. Verifies subscription creation, uniqueness constraints, and cancellation logic.

subscriptions.urls module¶

URL routing for the subscriptions application. Defines paths for users to manage their content subscriptions and newsletters.

subscriptions.views module¶

Views for the subscriptions application. Implements the business logic for subscribing to and unsubscribing from publishers and journalists.

subscriptions.views.subscribe(request)[source]¶

Subscribe to a publisher or journalist.

subscriptions.views.subscription_list(request)[source]¶

List all subscriptions for the current user.

subscriptions.views.unsubscribe(request, subscription_id)[source]¶

Unsubscribe from a subscription.

Module contents¶

Initialization for the subscriptions application package.
